title: Drawing, "Design for a Doorway to the Sacristy of St. Peter's, Rome", ca. 1778
medium:
Pen, brown ink, brown and gray wash, graphite
Support: cream laid paper
markings: Marks: Upper part is similar to Churchill 405.
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite (or black chalk) at right, horizontally: dalla soglia alla cornize P 23 ; vertically: creden/ Altezza
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Doorframe is surmounted by a pointed attic pediment, enclosing a medallion, in the center of which is the symbol of Christ (the Chi Rho) amidst a glory of rays. It is framed by palm branches and moldings. On top is a winged cherub's head. A priest standing in the doorway holds a reliquary before a kneeling cleric. Another cleric approaches from the left. Below are two plans.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Doorway to the Sacristy of St. Peter's, Rome", ca. 1778.
ca. 1778. Pen, brown ink, brown and gray wash, graphite
Support: cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2181.
